channel.title: Software-Access on GIS, maps + data @ Harvard Library
channel.description: Recent content in Software-Access on GIS, maps + data @ Harvard Library

item.title: ArcGIS Pro Access & Support at Harvard
item.description:
• Access ArcGIS Pro On Your Own Computer
  • Use ArcGIS Pro at the Library
    • Lamont Media Lab
    • Widener Atkins Reading Room
    • Cabot Science Library
    • Graduate School of Design (GSD) Frances Loeb Library
    • Harvard Kennedy School (HKS) Library
    • Countway Library
  • Access ArcGIS From Institute for Quantitative Social Science Lab
  • Access ArcGIS from a HUIT laptop
  • Access ArcGIS from House Commuter Labs
  • ArcGIS Pro Tutorials and Support
  • GIS Technical Support from the Harvard Map Collection

ArcGIS Pro is a powerful, proprietary desktop GIS software developed by Esri. It is widely used in various industries and academic disciplines for advanced spatial analysis, mapping, and data management.

item.title: Download QGIS Software
item.description:
QGIS is a free and open-source desktop GIS software used to create, edit, visualize, analyze, and publish geospatial information on Windows, Mac, Linux, BSD and mobile devices.

How to Download

  1. Visit QGIS.org .
  2. Select Download Now.
  3. Select your desired platform.

Tips

  • If you have the option between many installer packages, choose Standalone Long Term Release.
  • To learn your way around the QGIS interface, you can check out these resources:
    • Understanding the QGIS Interface
    • QGIS Documentation

Installation Troubleshooting on Mac

  • If you get an error message that Apple can’t check the app for malicious software, instead of double-clicking the icon to open the program, instead try right-clicking, and select Open.
  • You should only have to do this the first time you open the software. This message is popping up because the app is not available through the app store; it is developed through the open-source GIS community.
